alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon; Mifflin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON AND SOUTHWESTERN MIFFLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles south of Huntingdon, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Union, Rockhill Furnace, Mapleton, Orbisonia, Kistler, Newton Hamilton and Shirleysburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
